subject: Re: [junit] Documenting test cases
msgSnippet: ... What if throwsNPE() also throws IOException? -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603 Let s write
messageBody:
David Plass wrote:

> Negative tests are different... I'd write
> public void testExceptions() { // note no throws
> try {
> method.throwsNPE();
> fail("Should have thrown NPE");
> } catch (NullPointerException expected) {
> assertTrue("Should catch NPE", true);
> }
> }
>
> to test the fact that 'method.throwsNPE' should throw NPE.

What if throwsNPE() also throws IOException?
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
